00023 {
00036 template<typename ForwardIterator, typename T, typename CMP> bool
00037 continousFind( ForwardIterator &current, const ForwardIterator end, const T &compare, CMP compOp )
00038 {
00039     //find the first iterator which is does not compare less
00040     current = std::lower_bound( current, end, compare, compOp );
00041 
00042     if ( current == end //if we're at the end
00043          || compOp( compare, *current ) //or compare is less than that iterator
00044        )
00045         return false;//we didn't find a match
00046     else
00047         return true;//not(current <> compare) makes compare == current
00048 }
00049 }
00051 API_EXCLUDE_END

00069 // The core tree traversal functions
00071 PropertyMap::mapped_type &PropertyMap::fetchEntry( const PropPath &path )
00072 {
00073     return fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00074 }
00079 PropertyMap::mapped_type &PropertyMap::fetchEntry(
00080     PropertyMap &root,
00081     const isis::util::PropertyMap::propPathIterator at, const isis::util::PropertyMap::propPathIterator pathEnd )
00082 {
00083     PropPath::const_iterator next = at;
00084     next++;
00085     Container &rootRef = root;
00086     iterator found = static_cast<Container &>( root ).find( *at );
00087 
00088     if ( next != pathEnd ) {//we are not at the end of the path (a proposed leaf in the PropMap)
00089         if ( found != root.end() ) {//and we found the entry
00090             mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00091             LOG_IF( ref.is_leaf(), Runtime, error )
00092                     << util::MSubject( found->first ) << " is a leaf, but was requested as a branch in "
00093                     << util::MSubject( util::listToString( at, pathEnd, "/" ) );
00094             return fetchEntry( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); //continue there
00095         } else { // if we should create a sub-map
00096             //insert a empty branch (aka PropMap) at "*at" (and fetch the reference of that)
00097             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating an empty branch " << *at << " trough fetching";
00098             return fetchEntry( rootRef[*at].getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); // and continue there
00099         }
00100     } else { //if its the leaf
00101         LOG_IF( rootRef.find( *at ) == rootRef.end() , Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating an empty entry " << *at << " trough fetching";
00102         return rootRef[*at]; // (create and) return that entry
00103     }
00104 }
00105 
00110 const PropertyMap::mapped_type *PropertyMap::findEntry(
00111     const PropertyMap &root,
00112     const propPathIterator at, const propPathIterator pathEnd )
00113 {
00114     propPathIterator next = at;
00115     next++;
00116     util::PropertyMap::const_iterator found = static_cast<const Container &>( root ).find( *at );
00117 
00118     if ( next != pathEnd ) {//we are not at the end of the path (aka the leaf)
00119         if ( found != root.end() ) {//and we found the entry
00120             const mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00121             return findEntry( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); //continue there
00122         }
00123     } else if ( found != root.end() ) {// if its the leaf and we found the entry
00124         return &found->second; // return that entry
00125     }
00126 
00127     return NULL;
00128 }
00129 bool PropertyMap::recursiveRemove( PropertyMap &root, const propPathIterator path_it, const propPathIterator pathEnd )
00130 {
00131     bool ret = false;
00132 
00133     if ( path_it != pathEnd ) {
00134         propPathIterator next = path_it;
00135         next++;
00136         iterator found = static_cast<Container &>( root ).find( *path_it );
00137 
00138         if ( found != root.end() ) {
00139             mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00140 
00141             if ( ! ref.is_leaf() ) {
00142                 ret = recursiveRemove( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd );
00143 
00144                 if ( ref.getBranch().isEmpty() )
00145                     root.erase( found ); // remove the now empty branch
00146             } else {
00147                 root.erase( found );
00148                 ret = true;
00149             }
00150         } else {
00151             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Entry " << util::MSubject( *path_it ) << " not found, skipping it";
00152         }
00153     }
00154 
00155     return ret;
00156 }

00163 const std::vector< PropertyValue >& PropertyMap::propertyValueVec( const isis::util::PropertyMap::PropPath &path ) const
00164 {
00165     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00166 
00167     if( ref && ref->is_leaf() ) {
00168         return ref->getLeaf();
00169     } else {
00170         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Property " << path << " not found. Returning empty property.";
00171         static const _internal::treeNode emptyEntry;
00172         return emptyEntry.getLeaf();
00173     }
00174 }
00175 
00176 std::vector< PropertyValue >& PropertyMap::propertyValueVec( const isis::util::PropertyMap::PropPath &path )
00177 {
00178     mapped_type &n = fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00179     LOG_IF( ! n.is_leaf(), Debug, error ) << "Using branch " << path << " as PropertyValue";
00180     return n.getLeaf();
00181 }

00184 const PropertyValue &PropertyMap::propertyValue( const isis::util::PropertyMap::PropPath &path )const
00185 {
00186     return propertyValueVec( path )[0];
00187 }
00188 
00189 PropertyValue &PropertyMap::propertyValue( const isis::util::PropertyMap::PropPath &path )
00190 {
00191     std::vector< PropertyValue > &p = propertyValueVec( path );
00192     p.resize( 1 ); // the user is expecting only one entry, so remove the others
00193     return p[0];
00194 }
00195 
00196 const PropertyMap &PropertyMap::branch( const isis::util::PropertyMap::PropPath &path ) const
00197 {
00198     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00199 
00200     if( ! ref ) {
00201         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Trying to access non existing branch " << path << ".";
00202         static const _internal::treeNode emptyEntry;
00203         return emptyEntry.getBranch();
00204     } else {
00205         LOG_IF( ref->getBranch().isEmpty(), Runtime, warning ) << "Accessing empty branch " << path;
00206         return ref->getBranch();
00207     }
00208 }
00209 PropertyMap &PropertyMap::branch( const PropPath &path )
00210 {
00211     mapped_type &n = fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00212     return n.getBranch();
00213 }

00215 bool PropertyMap::remove( const PropPath &path )
00216 {
00217     return recursiveRemove( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00218 }
00219 
00220 bool PropertyMap::remove( const KeyList &removeList, bool keep_needed )
00221 {
00222     bool ret = true;
00223     BOOST_FOREACH( const KeyType & key, removeList ) {
00224         if( hasProperty( key ) ) { // remove everything which is there
00225             if( !( propertyValue( key ).isNeeded() && keep_needed ) ) { // if its not needed or keep_need is not true
00226                 ret &= remove( key );
00227             }
00228         }
00229     }
00230     return ret;
00231 }
00232 
00233 
00234 bool PropertyMap::remove( const isis::util::PropertyMap &removeMap, bool keep_needed )
00235 {
00236     iterator thisIt = begin();
00237     bool ret = true;
00238 
00239     //remove everything that is also in second
00240     for ( const_iterator otherIt = removeMap.begin(); otherIt != removeMap.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00241         //find the closest match for otherIt->first in this (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00242         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //thisIt->first == otherIt->first - so its the same property or propmap
00243             if ( ! thisIt->second.is_leaf() ) { //this is a branch
00244                 if ( ! otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) { // recurse if its a branch in the removal map as well
00245                     PropertyMap &mySub = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00246                     const PropertyMap &otherSub = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00247                     ret &= mySub.remove( otherSub );
00248 
00249                     if( mySub.isEmpty() ) // delete my branch, if its empty
00250                         erase( thisIt++ );
00251                 } else {
00252                     LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Not deleting branch " << MSubject( thisIt->first ) << " because its no subtree in the removal map";
00253                     ret = false;
00254                 }
00255             } else if( !( thisIt->second.getLeaf()[0].isNeeded() && keep_needed ) ) { // this is a leaf
00256                 erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00257             }
00258         }
00259     }
00260 
00261     return ret;
00262 }

00266 // utilities
00268 bool PropertyMap::isValid() const
00269 {
00270     //iterate through the whole map and return false as soon as we find something needed _and_ empty
00271     const const_iterator found = std::find_if( begin(), end(), treeInvalidP() );
00272     return found == end();
00273 }

00275 bool PropertyMap::isEmpty() const
00276 {
00277     return Container::empty();

00280 PropertyMap::DiffMap PropertyMap::getDifference( const PropertyMap &other ) const
00281 {
00282     PropertyMap::DiffMap ret;
00283     diffTree( other, ret, "" );
00284     return ret;
00285 }
00286 
00287 void PropertyMap::diffTree( const PropertyMap &other, PropertyMap::DiffMap &ret, istring prefix ) const
00288 {
00289     const_iterator otherIt = other.begin();
00290 
00291     //insert everything that is in this, but not in second or is on both but differs
00292     for ( const_iterator thisIt = begin(); thisIt != end(); thisIt++ ) {
00293         const PropPath::value_type pathname = prefix + thisIt->first;
00294 
00295         //find the closest match for thisIt->first in other (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00296         if ( _internal::continousFind( otherIt, other.end(), *thisIt, value_comp() ) ) { //otherIt->first == thisIt->first - so its the same property
00297             const mapped_type &first = thisIt->second, &second = otherIt->second;
00298 
00299             if ( ! ( first.is_leaf() || second.is_leaf() ) ) { // if both are a branch
00300                 const PropertyMap &thisMap = first.getBranch();
00301                 const PropertyMap &refMap = second.getBranch();
00302                 thisMap.diffTree( refMap, ret, pathname + "/" );
00303             } else if ( ! ( first == second )  ) { // if they are not equal
00304                 const PropertyValue firstVal = first.is_leaf() ? first.getLeaf()[0] : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( first.toString() ) );
00305                 const PropertyValue secondVal = second.is_leaf() ? second.getLeaf()[0] : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( second.toString() ) );
00306                 ret.insert( // add (propertyname|(value1|value2))
00307                     ret.end(),      // we know it has to be at the end
00308                     std::make_pair(
00309                         pathname,   //the key
00310                         std::make_pair( firstVal, secondVal ) //pair of both values
00311                     )
00312                 );
00313             }
00314         } else { // if ref is not in the other map
00315             const PropertyValue firstVal = thisIt->second.is_leaf() ? thisIt->second.getLeaf()[0] : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( thisIt->second.toString() ) );
00316             ret.insert( // add (propertyname|(value1|[empty]))
00317                 ret.end(),      // we know it has to be at the end
00318                 std::make_pair(
00319                     pathname,
00320                     std::make_pair( firstVal, PropertyValue() )
00321                 )
00322             );
00323         }
00324     }
00325 
00326     //insert everything that is in second but not in this
00327     const_iterator thisIt = begin();
00328 
00329     for ( otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00330         const PropPath::value_type pathname = prefix + otherIt->first;
00331 
00332         if ( ! _internal::continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //there is nothing in this which has the same key as ref
00333             const PropertyValue secondVal = otherIt->second.is_leaf() ? otherIt->second.getLeaf()[0] : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( otherIt->second.toString() ) );
00334             ret.insert(
00335                 std::make_pair( // add (propertyname|([empty]|value2))
00336                     pathname,
00337                     std::make_pair( PropertyValue(), secondVal )
00338                 )
00339             );
00340         }
00341     }
00342 }
00343 
00344 void PropertyMap::removeEqual ( const util::PropertyMap &other, bool removeNeeded )
00345 {
00346     iterator thisIt = begin();
00347 
00348     //remove everything that is also in second and equal (or also empty)
00349     for ( const_iterator otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00350         //find the closest match for otherIt->first in this (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00351         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //thisIt->first == otherIt->first  - so its the same property
00352             if ( ! removeNeeded && thisIt->second.getLeaf()[0].isNeeded() ) {//Skip needed
00353                 thisIt++;
00354                 continue;
00355             }
00356 
00357             if ( thisIt->second.empty() ) { //this is empty
00358                 if ( otherIt->second.empty() ) { //the other is empty
00359                     erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00360                 } else {
00361                     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Keeping the empty " << thisIt->first << " because its is not empty in the other (" << *otherIt << ")";
00362                     thisIt++;
00363                 }
00364             } else if ( ! otherIt->second.empty() ) { // if the other is not empty as well
00365                 if ( thisIt->second == otherIt->second ) { //delete this, if they are equal
00366                     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Removing " << *thisIt << " because its equal with the other (" << *otherIt << ")";
00367                     erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00368                 } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second.is_leaf() || otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) ) { //but maybe they are branches
00369                     PropertyMap &thisMap = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00370                     const PropertyMap &otherMap = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00371                     thisMap.removeEqual( otherMap );
00372                     thisIt++;
00373                 }
00374             } else {//only the other is empty
00375                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Keeping " << *thisIt << " because the other is empty";
00376                 thisIt++;
00377             }
00378         }
00379     }
00380 }

00383 PropertyMap::KeyList PropertyMap::join( const isis::util::PropertyMap &other, bool overwrite )
00384 {
00385     KeyList rejects;
00386     joinTree( other, overwrite, "", rejects );
00387     return rejects;
00388 }
00389 
00390 void PropertyMap::joinTree( const isis::util::PropertyMap &other, bool overwrite, util::istring prefix, PropertyMap::KeyList &rejects )
00391 {
00392     iterator thisIt = begin();
00393 
00394     for ( const_iterator otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) { //iterate through the elements of other
00395         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { // if the element is allready here
00396             if ( thisIt->second.empty() ) { // if ours is empty
00397                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Replacing empty property " << MSubject( thisIt->first ) << " by " << MSubject( otherIt->second );
00398                 thisIt->second = otherIt->second;
00399             } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second.is_leaf() || otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) ) { // if both are a subtree
00400                 PropertyMap &thisMap = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00401                 const PropertyMap &refMap = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00402                 thisMap.joinTree( refMap, overwrite, prefix + thisIt->first + "/", rejects ); //recursion
00403             } else if ( overwrite ) { // otherwise replace ours by the other (if we shall overwrite)
00404                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Replacing property " << MSubject( *thisIt ) << " by " << MSubject( otherIt->second );
00405                 thisIt->second = otherIt->second;
00406             } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second == otherIt->second ) ) { // otherwise put the other into rejected if its not equal to our
00407                 LOG( Debug, info )
00408                         << "Rejecting property " << MSubject( *otherIt )
00409                         << " because " << MSubject( thisIt->second ) << " is allready there";
00410                 rejects.insert( rejects.end(), prefix + otherIt->first );
00411             }
00412         } else { // ok we dont have that - just insert it
00413             std::pair<const_iterator, bool> inserted = insert( *otherIt );
00414             LOG_IF( inserted.second, Debug, verbose_info ) << "Inserted property " << MSubject( *inserted.first ) << ".";
00415         }
00416     }
00417 }

00420 void PropertyMap::makeFlatMap( FlatMap &out, key_type key_prefix ) const
00421 {
00422     for ( const_iterator i = begin(); i != end(); i++ ) {
00423         key_type key = ( key_prefix.empty() ? "" : key_prefix + pathSeperator ) + i->first;
00424 
00425         if ( i->second.is_leaf()  ) {
00426             out.insert( std::make_pair( key, i->second.getLeaf()[0] ) );
00427         } else {
00428             i->second.getBranch().makeFlatMap( out, key );
00429         }
00430     }
00431 }
00432 
00433 PropertyMap::FlatMap PropertyMap::getFlatMap() const
00434 {
00435     isis::util::PropertyMap::FlatMap buff;
00436     makeFlatMap( buff );
00437     return buff;
00438 }

00441 bool PropertyMap::transform( const PropPath &from,  const PropPath &to, int dstID, bool delSource )
00442 {
00443     const PropertyValue &found = propertyValue( from );
00444     bool ret = false;
00445 
00446     if( ! found.isEmpty() ) {
00447         util::ValueReference &dst = static_cast<util::ValueReference &>( propertyValue( to ) );
00448 
00449         if ( found.getTypeID() == dstID ) {
00450             if( from != to ) {
00451                 dst = found ;
00452                 ret = true;
00453             } else {
00454                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not transforming " << MSubject( found ) << " into same type at same place.";
00455             }
00456         } else {
00457             LOG_IF( from == to, Debug, warning ) << "Transforming " << MSubject( found ) << " in place.";
00458             dst = ( *found ).copyByID( dstID );
00459             ret = !dst.isEmpty();
00460         }
00461     }
00462 
00463     if ( ret && delSource )remove( from );
00464 
00465     return ret;
00466 }

00498 void PropertyMap::addNeededFromString( const std::string &needed )
00499 {
00500     const std::list<std::string> needList = util::stringToList<std::string>( needed );
00501     //@todo util::stringToList<std::string>( needed,' ' ) would be faster but less robust
00502     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Adding " << needed << " as needed";
00503     BOOST_FOREACH( std::list<std::string>::const_reference ref, needList ) {
00504         addNeeded( key_type( ref.c_str() ) );

00508 bool PropertyMap::hasProperty( const PropPath &path ) const
00509 {
00510     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00511     return ( ref && ref->is_leaf() && ! ref->getLeaf()[0].isEmpty() );
00512 }
00513 
00514 isis::util::PropertyMap::KeyType PropertyMap::find( isis::util::PropertyMap::KeyType key, bool allowProperty, bool allowBranch ) const
00515 {
00516     // make sure we only get the last part of the path if its one
00517     const PropPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00518 
00519     if( path.empty() ) {
00520         LOG( Debug, error ) << "Search key " << util::MSubject( key ) << " is invalid, won't search";
00521         return KeyType();
00522     } else if( path.size() > 1 ) {
00523         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Stripping search key " << util::MSubject( key ) << " to " << path.back();
00524     }
00525 
00526     key = path.back();
00527 
00528     // if the searched key is on this brach return its name
00529     const Container &map = static_cast<const Container &>( *this );
00530     Container::const_iterator found = map.find( key );
00531 
00532     if( found != map.end() &&
00533         ( ( found->second.is_leaf() && allowProperty ) || ( !found->second.is_leaf() && allowBranch ) )
00534       ) {
00535         return found->first;
00536     } else { // otherwise search in the branches (getBranch() returns an empty PropMap for leaves - we wont have to check for that)
00537         BOOST_FOREACH( Container::const_reference ref, map ) {
00538             const KeyType foundKey = ref.second.getBranch().find( key, allowProperty, allowBranch );
00539 
00540             if( !foundKey.empty() ) // if the key is found abort search and return it with its branch-name
00541                 return ref.first + "/" + foundKey;
00542         }
00543     }
00544 
00545     return KeyType(); // nothing found
00546 }
00547 
00548 bool PropertyMap::hasBranch( const PropPath &path ) const
00549 {
00550     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00551     return ( ref && ! ref->is_leaf()  );
00552 }
00553 
00554 bool PropertyMap::rename( const PropPath &oldname,  const PropPath &newname )
00555 {
00556     const mapped_type *old_e = findEntry( oldname );
00557     const mapped_type *new_e = findEntry( newname );
00558 
00559     if ( old_e ) {
00560         LOG_IF( new_e && ! new_e->empty(), Runtime, warning )
00561                 << "Overwriting " << std::make_pair( newname, *new_e ) << " with " << *old_e;
00562         fetchEntry( newname ) = *old_e;
00563         return remove( oldname );
00564     } else {
00565         LOG( Runtime, warning )
00566                 << "Cannot rename " << oldname << " it does not exist";
00567         return false;
00568     }
00569 }
00570 
00571 void PropertyMap::toCommonUnique( PropertyMap &common, std::set<key_type> &uniques, bool init )const
00572 {
00573     if ( init ) {
00574         common = *this;
00575         uniques.clear();
00576         return;
00577     } else {
00578         const DiffMap difference = common.getDifference( *this );
00579         BOOST_FOREACH( const DiffMap::value_type & ref, difference ) {
00580             uniques.insert( ref.first );
00581 
00582             if ( ! ref.second.first.isEmpty() )common.remove( ref.first );//if there is something in common, remove it
00583         }
00584     }
00585 }
00586 
00587 std::ostream &PropertyMap::print( std::ostream &out, bool label )const
00588 {
00589     FlatMap buff;
00590     makeFlatMap( buff );
00591     size_t key_len = 0;
00592 
00593     for ( FlatMap::const_iterator i = buff.begin(); i != buff.end(); i++ )
00594         if ( key_len < i->first.length() )
00595             key_len = i->first.length();
00596 
00597     for ( FlatMap::const_iterator i = buff.begin(); i != buff.end(); i++ )
00598         out << i->first << std::string( key_len - i->first.length(), ' ' ) + ":" << i->second.toString( label ) << std::endl;
00599 
00600     return out;
00601 }

00603 const PropertyMap::mapped_type *PropertyMap::findEntry( const PropPath &path )const
00604 {
00605     return findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00606 }

00608 
00609 bool PropertyMap::listP::operator()( const std::pair< const isis::util::istring, _internal::treeNode >& ref ) const
00610 {
00611     return ref.second.is_leaf() && ref.second.getLeaf().size() > 1;
00612 }
00613 
00614 bool PropertyMap::trueP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &/*ref*/ ) const
00615 {
00616     return true;
00617 }
00618 bool PropertyMap::invalidP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &ref ) const
00619 {
00620     return ref.second.getLeaf()[0].isNeeded() && ref.second.getLeaf()[0].isEmpty();
00621 }
00622 bool PropertyMap::treeInvalidP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &ref ) const
00623 {
00624     if ( ref.second.is_leaf() ) {
00625         const PropertyValue &val = ref.second.getLeaf()[0];
00626         return val.isNeeded() && val.isEmpty();
00627     } else  {
00628         return ! ref.second.getBranch().isValid();
00629     }
00630 }

00632 }
